A reminder to the community as we start school, please be cautious around buses, as well as students that are walking to school.

- When you see a school bus, assume children will be around and take extra care ‚Äì leave lots of space around the bus.

- When the bus turns on the flashing yellow lights ‚Äì this means it is about to stop either at a railroad crossing or to pick up kids. Slow down and prepare to stop.

- When the bus turns on the flashing red lights ‚Äì this means STOP in BOTH directions. Never pass a school bus with flashing red lights in either direction. Stop well back from the bus. If you have any doubt what to do ‚Äì STOP.

Let's all do our part to keep our children safe!

You will notice as you drive by the CCHS campus that the stadium lights are on for a short time in the evening during the week. CCHS is taking part in a nationwide program called ‚ÄòBe the Light.‚Äô
Throughout the remainder of the school year, the stadium lights will come on at 8:20 PM (20:20 military time) every evening, Monday through Friday, and will remain on for 20 minutes. This display of support 1) recognizes all of the seniors and early graduates in the Class of 2020, whose final year has been somewhat taken from them; 2) to say ‚ÄòThank You‚Äô to all of the custodians, those helping with meal prep each day, and bus drivers in the district who help deliver meals and provide WiFi hotspots around our community; and 3) to recognize the effort and sacrifice given by ALL medical, health care and emergency professionals in their fight against COVID-19.
We invite you to honk your horn with three short blasts if you drive by the stadium complex while the lights are on to show support for these three groups. We love all of you, we miss our students, and we are stronger together. #BeTheLight

Garrett Kalt is with Sara Beebe and 38 others.
April 1 at 9:04 AM ¬∑

Today is National Census Day! 36% of Nevadans have completed their census ‚Äî did you finish yours?

Please SHARE this video to help our state receive its fair share of federal funding.

The NVCensus2020 is important, safe and easy. Nevada will earn $20,000 in federal funding over the next ten years for every person who is counted. Responses can only be used for statistical purposes and the questions asked regard basic demographic information. You will not be asked about your finances, social security number, or citizenship status. Lastly, the census is easy! It takes less than ten minutes, is about ten questions, and you will make an impact for ten years!

Complete your census online (census.nv.gov), by phone (English: (844) 330.2020; Spanish: (844) 468.2020) or in the mail today! Completing it ahead of time means no Census worker will show up at your home in May/June.
